1.text: Better is a poor [man] that walketh in his integrity, than he that is perverse in his lips, and is a fool.

2.text: Also that a person be without knowledge is not good; and he that hasteth with his feet maketh false steps.

3.text: The folly of man distorteth his way, and his heart is irritated against Jehovah.

4.text: Wealth addeth many friends; but the poor is separated from his friend.

5.text: A false witness shall not be held innocent, and he that uttereth lies shall not escape.

6.text: Many court the favour of a noble; and every one is friend to a man that giveth.

7.text: All the brethren of a poor [man] hate him; how much more do his friends go far from him: he pursueth [them] with words,—they are not [to be found].

8.text: He that getteth sense loveth his own soul; he that keepeth understanding shall find good.

9.text: A false witness shall not be held innocent, and he that uttereth lies shall perish.

10.text: Good living beseemeth not a fool; how much less for a servant to have rule over princes.

11.text: The discretion of a man maketh him slow to anger, and it is his glory to pass over a transgression.

12.text: The king’s displeasure is as the roaring of a lion; but his favour is as dew upon the grass.

13.text: A foolish son is the calamity of his father; and the contentions of a wife are a continual dropping.

14.text: House and wealth are an inheritance from fathers; but a prudent wife is from Jehovah.

15.text: Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep, and the idle soul shall suffer hunger.

16.text: He that keepeth the commandment keepeth his soul; he that is careless of his ways shall die.

17.text: He that is gracious to the poor lendeth unto Jehovah; and what he hath bestowed will he repay unto him.

18.text: Chasten thy son, seeing there is hope; but set not thy soul upon killing him.

19.text: A man of great wrath shall suffer punishment; for if thou deliver [him], yet thou must do it again.

20.text: Hear counsel, and receive instruction, that thou mayest be wise in thy latter end.

21.text: Many are the thoughts in a man’s heart, but the counsel of Jehovah, that doth stand.

22.text: The charm of a man is his kindness; and a poor [man] is better than a liar.

23.text: The fear of Jehovah [tendeth] to life, and he [that hath it] shall rest satisfied without being visited with evil.

24.text: A sluggard burieth his hand in the dish, and will not even bring it to his mouth again.

25.text: Smite a scorner, and the simple will beware; reprove the intelligent, and he will understand knowledge.

26.text: He that ruineth [his] father and chaseth away [his] mother is a son that causeth shame and bringeth reproach.

27.text: Cease, my son, to hear the instruction which causeth to stray from the words of knowledge.

28.text: A witness of Belial scorneth judgment, and the mouth of the wicked swalloweth down iniquity.

29.text: Judgments are prepared for scorners, and stripes for the back of the foolish.
